title: Keystroke dynamics as a biomarker for Parkinson's disease
methodology: Cross-sectional study comparing keystroke dynamics between PD patients and controls
key_findings: Dwell time increased by 23% in early PD compared to controls (p<0.001)
Flight time variability increased by 40% in PD patients
Keystroke dynamics could detect PD with 81.3% accuracy
Tremor frequency analysis showed 4-6Hz oscillations in typing patterns
Left-right asymmetry correlated with UPDRS motor scores (r=0.67)

title: Acoustic analysis of voice in Parkinson's disease: A systematic review and meta-analysis
methodology: Meta-analysis of 15 studies examining voice biomarkers in PD
key_findings: Jitter >1.04% discriminates PD with 85% sensitivity, 90% specificity
Shimmer >3.81% present in 92% of PD patients vs 18% controls
HNR <20dB correlates with disease severity (UPDRS r=-0.72)
Voice onset time increased by 15-25ms in PD patients
Fundamental frequency variability reduced by 30% in PD
limitations: Heterogeneous study populations, medication effects not controlled

title: Digital biomarkers for Alzheimer's disease: The mobile/wearable devices opportunity
methodology: Longitudinal cohort study tracking cognitive decline using digital biomarkers
key_findings: Word-finding pauses increase 65% in MCI vs controls (p<0.001)
Semantic fluency decline detectable 3-5 years before clinical diagnosis
Typing patterns show working memory strain 2.3 years before MoCA decline
Semantic substitutions increase 3x in prodromal AD
Digital clock drawing test sensitive to visuospatial decline
limitations: Technology familiarity bias, need for larger diverse cohorts

title: Mouse movement analysis for early detection of mild cognitive impairment
methodology: Prospective cohort study using continuous home monitoring
key_findings: Mouse velocity decreased 12% per year in MCI vs 3% in controls
Click accuracy declined 8% annually in those who developed dementia
Hesitation patterns increased 45% in preclinical AD
Tremor amplitude correlated with cognitive test scores (r=-0.58)
Combined metrics predicted MCI conversion with 78% accuracy
limitations: Age-related technology barriers, need for standardized protocols

title: Multimodal biomarkers for multiple sclerosis using digital health technologies
methodology: Cross-sectional validation study of digital biomarkers in MS
key_findings: Intention tremor detected with 92% sensitivity using trackpad analysis
Heat sensitivity measurable through performance degradation patterns
Asymmetric motor patterns correlate with lesion laterality (r=0.71)
Fatigue index derived from typing patterns matches patient reports
Combined digital score correlates with EDSS (r=0.83)
limitations: Small sample size, need for longitudinal validation

title: Speech and voice changes in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis: A systematic review
methodology: Systematic review and acoustic analysis of bulbar ALS
key_findings: Voice quality deterioration detectable 6-12 months before clinical bulbar symptoms
Jitter increases to >1.5% in 87% of bulbar-onset ALS patients
Shimmer elevation >5% correlates with swallowing difficulty onset
Speech rate decline of >15% predicts respiratory involvement
Formant centralization ratio decreases 18 months before dysarthria diagnosis
limitations: Heterogeneous measurement methods, small individual studies

title: Validation of digital biomarkers for neurological assessment
methodology: Multi-site validation study across 5 neurological conditions
key_findings: Digital biomarkers show 89% concordance with clinical assessments
Remote monitoring captures 15x more data points than clinic visits
Inter-rater reliability >0.95 for automated measurements
Cost reduction of 67% compared to traditional assessments
Patient satisfaction score 4.6/5 for digital monitoring

title: Ethical considerations for digital biomarkers in neurological diseases
methodology: Systematic review of ethical frameworks for digital biomarkers
key_findings: Informed consent must address continuous monitoring implications
Data ownership and sharing rights need clear frameworks
Algorithmic bias risks in diverse populations require mitigation
False positive anxiety management is crucial in screening applications
Regulatory pathways need adaptation for continuous monitoring devices

title: Machine learning approaches for early Parkinson's disease detection using gait analysis
methodology: Machine learning validation using smartphone accelerometer data
key_findings: Gait asymmetry detects early PD with 91% accuracy using smartphone sensors
Stride length variability increases 34% in prodromal PD
Freezing of gait episodes predicted 72 hours in advance
Machine learning models outperform clinical assessment by 23%
Real-world validation shows 87% concordance with clinic-based measures

title: Regulatory pathways for software as medical device (SaMD) in neurology
authors: FDA Digital Health Center of Excellence
key_findings: Class II SaMD pathway appropriate for cognitive screening tools
Clinical validation requires 510(k) predicate comparison
Real-world evidence can supplement clinical trials
Post-market surveillance mandatory for adaptive algorithms
Cybersecurity and privacy controls essential for approval
limitations: Evolving regulatory landscape, international harmonization needed
